articles.title: Coronavirus deaths exceed Sars fatalities in 2003
articles.description: In China's Hubei province alone the death toll reaches 780, six more than the total for Sars in 2003.
articles.content:
Image copyrightGetty ImagesImage caption
 More than 34,000 people have been diagnosed with the new coronavirus
The number of coronavirus deaths has overtaken that of the Sars epidemic in 2003.
In China's Hubei province alone, the epicentre of the latest ou… [+571 chars]

articles.title: Newspaper headlines: UK faces 'major' outbreak and 'mansion tax' plans
articles.description: An expert's fears that the UK faces a "major" coronavirus outbreak is among Sunday's front-page stories.

articles.title: World Health Organisation says new coronavirus cases has slowed
articles.description: The World Health Organisation says the number of new coronavirus cases in the worst affected region of China appears to have stabilised slightly in the past four days. The WHO says the virus remained concentrated in Hubei province and that this may reflect th…

articles.title: Amazon deforestation remains high despite rains
articles.description: A new report shows that the rate of deforestation in Brazil is double what it was a year ago. Also in the programme: China is opening a second rapidly-built hospital in Wuhan to deal with the coronavirus outbreak which has killed more than seven hundred peopl…

articles.title: Odion Ighalo: Coronavirus fears mean Man Utd striker will miss training camp
articles.description: Manchester United's Odion Ighalo will miss the club's training camp in Spain because of fears the coronavirus outbreak could lead to him being refused entry back into the UK.
articles.content:
Odion Ighalo joined Manchester United on loan until the end of the season on transfer deadline day
